item.title: Some Intuition Behind Hierarchical Modeling
item.description: This is an archive of an external source Hierarchical modeling is a powerful tool for making inferences about multiple groups in clinical trials, whether these groups are multiple indications or tumor types in an oncology study, multiple sites in a device clinical trial, or any other source of patient heterogeneity. Hierarchical models that share information across groups form a backbone of modern Bayesian thinking. We currently employ hierarchical modeling most commonly in our oncology basket trials, see for example Berry et.
